problem.tex: Let $\Omega$ be a region and $f$ a holomorphic function on $\Omega$. Then the following are equivalent: 1) $f=0$ 2) The set $\{z\in\Omega|f(z)=0\}$ has a limit point in $\Omega$. 3) There is a point $a\in\Omega$ for which $f^{(n)}(a)=0$ for all $n\geq0$.

solution.tex: Proof is analysis with power series
